name: lib/Constants.js
content:
"use strict";

import keyMirror from "keymirror";

export default {
  OAUTH_HEADER: "X-Shopify-Access-Token",

  Actions: keyMirror({
    SET_SHOP: null,
    CLEAR_SHOP: null,

    SET_SESSION: null,
    CLEAR_SESSION: null,

    MERGE_COUNTRIES: null,
    CLEAR_COUNTRIES: null,
    COUNT_COUNTRIES: null,
    DESTROY_COUNTRIES: null,

    MERGE_ORDERS: null,
    CLEAR_ORDERS: null,
    COUNT_ORDERS: null,
    DESTROY_ORDERS: null,

    MERGE_PRODUCTS: null,
    CLEAR_PRODUCTS: null,
    COUNT_PRODUCTS: null,
    DESTROY_PRODUCTS: null,

    // FOR TESTING
    MERGE_THINGS: null,
    CLEAR_THINGS: null,
    COUNT_THINGS: null,
    DESTROY_THINGS: null
  })
};

lib/dispatcher/APIDispatcher.js
content:
"use strict";

import Flux from "flux";

const { Dispatcher } = Flux;

/**
 * A generic action object that is dispatched by {APIDispatcher}
 *
 * @typedef {object} Action
 * @property {string} actionType - The type of action being dispatched
 */

/**
 * An action object that is dispatched when items should be added to a store
 *
 * @typedef {object} MergeAction
 * @property {string} actionType - The type of action being dispatched
 * @property {Array<object>} items - An array of items to be added to the store
 */

/**
 * An action object that is dispatched when counts should be added to a store
 *
 * @typedef {object} CountAction
 * @property {string} actionType - The type of action being dispatched
 * @property {number} count - The count returned from the API call
 * @property {ResourceQuery} [query] - The query params for the count call
 */

/**
 * An action object the is dispatched when an object is destroyed
 *
 * @typedef {object} DestroyAction
 * @property {string} actionType - The type of action being dispatched
 * @property {number|string} id - The id of the destroyed resource
 */

export default new Dispatcher();

name: Action
description: A generic action object that is dispatched by {APIDispatcher}

properties.name: actionType
properties.description: The type of action being dispatched

name: MergeAction
description: An action object that is dispatched when items should be added to a store

properties.name: actionType
properties.description: The type of action being dispatched

properties.name: items
properties.description: An array of items to be added to the store

name: CountAction
description: An action object that is dispatched when counts should be added to a store

properties.name: actionType
properties.description: The type of action being dispatched

properties.name: count
properties.description: The count returned from the API call

properties.name: query
properties.description: The query params for the count call

name: DestroyAction
description: An action object the is dispatched when an object is destroyed

properties.name: actionType
properties.description: The type of action being dispatched

properties.name: id
properties.description: The id of the destroyed resource

lib/resources/Base.js
Base
description:
A base class for API resources. This class is meant to be subclassed and have it's `apiMethods` method overridden to
include all methods that should be made available to consumers.

name: constructor
description:
Using the supplied `resourceName`, this constructor will generate the singular and plural names for this resource
which will be used to infer the merge, count, and clear actions to be dispatched.

params.name: resourceName
params.description: The singular name for the resource (e.g. `product`)

params.name: options.countable
params.description: Whether or not this resource is countable (has a /count.json endpoint)

params.name: options.createable
params.description: Whether or not this resource can be created

params.name: options.destroyable
params.description: Whether or not this resource can be deleted

name: apiMethods
description: An array of methods to be exposed via {@link APIProxy}

return.description: The names of all methods to be made available

name: actions
description: Returns an object that supplies the clear, count and merge actions for this resource

name: fetch
description: Performs a GET request for the specified query.

name: fetchCount
description: Performs a GET request for the resource's count endpoint

name: create
description: Performs a POST request, sending the resource along as the request body

params.name: options
params.description: Options to be passed along to the request

name: update
description: Updates the given resource

params.name: options
params.description: Options to be passed along with the request

name: destroy
description: Destroys the resource

params.name: options
params.description: Options to be passed along with the request

name: clear
description: Dispatches the clear action for this resource. The action will be handled by the appropriate store.

name: urlFor
examples:
import Base from "./Base";

let instance = new Base("product");

instance.urlFor();                            // `/admin/products.json`
instance.urlFor(1);                           // `/admin/products/1.json`
instance.urlFor("1");                         // `/admin/products/1.json`
instance.urlFor(1, { type: "test" })          // `/admin/products/1.json?type=test
instance.urlFor({ fields: ["id", "title"] }); // `/admin/products.json?fields=id,title

params.name: params
params.description: Query string parameters (only used when query is a number or string)

return.description: The resource URL for the specified query

lib/stores/BaseStore.js
BaseStore
description:
A base class for resource stores.

Stores handle dispatch events from resources. When anything changes, the store's change event is omitted.

This store exposes a few methods (from it's base class). These include:

* `at(key)`  - returns the object with the specified key. Raises when not found
* `get(key)` - returns the object with the specified key. Returns undefined when not found
* `has(key)` - returns whether or not an object with the specified key exists in the store

name: where
description: Queries the store for resources matching the source object

name: reduce
description:
Used to reduce a stream of actions coming from the dispatcher into a
single state object. This will handle merge and clear actions for this resource.

**This method should not be called directly**, but rather via a call to the dispatcher's `dispatch` method.

params.name: action
params.description: The action sent by the dispatcher

return.description: The new state for this store

name: areEqual
description:
Determines whether or not the state of this store has changed.

**This method should not be called directly**

return.description: Whether or not the state's are identical

name: lib/stores/CountableStore.js
ResourceQuery
description:
An object representing a resource query.

Can be one of the following:
  * `number` - Assumes the value is a resource id
  * `string` - Assumes the value is a resource id
  * `object` - Will be converted to a query string

name: CountableStore
description: A base class for resource stores that are countable (have /count.json endpoints).

name: count
description: Returns the count for the given query

name: lib/stores/SessionStore.js
SessionStore
description:
The session store

This class doesn't inherit from the base store. Instead, it handles the `SET_SESSION` event. This event expects a
domain and accessToken property.

name: getDomain
description: Gets the domain for the session's shop

name: getAccessToken
description: Gets the API access token register for this session

name: lib/stores/ShopStore.js
ShopStore
description: The shop store

name: getCurrent
description: Gets the current shop based on the domain and accessToken registered with the session

constructor
description: Creates a new action object for the specified resource

name: lib/utilities/URLHelpers.js
lib/utilities/WebAPI.js
SuccessfulRequestCallback
description: A method signature for resolved request promises

name: FailedRequestCallback
description: A method signature for rejected request promises

name: RequestPromise
description: A {@link Promise} that resolves with a {@link SuccessfulRequestCallback} and rejects with a {@link FailedRequestCallback}

name: WebAPI
description:
A helper class for working with the REST API.

In all cases, no attempt is made to trap errors. {@link RequestPromise}s are returned from each method. It's up to the
caller to handle rejection.

name: get
description: Performs a GET request for the given URL and options

params.name: options
params.description: options to pass along to the fetch call

name: post
description: Performs a POST request for the given URL and options, passing the resource as the request body

params.name: resource
params.description: the resource to post as the request body

params.name: options
params.description: options to pass along to the fetch call

name: put
description: Performs a PUT request for the given URL and options, passing the resource as the request body

params.name: resource
params.description: the resource to post as the request body

params.name: options
params.description: options to pass along to the fetch call

name: delete
description: Performs a DELETE request for the given URL and options

params.name: options
params.description: options to pass along to the fetch call
